column1: User Type,Username,Date,Text
,efxr,2010-05-01T18:58Z,"You can download the full version of CS5 as a trail from Adobe.com (with 2MB per second, beats the 300 kpbs i'm getting now...)
http://trials2.adobe.com/AdobeProducts/STAM/CS5/osx10/MasterCollection_CS5_LS1.dmg
After this you can activate the product with simple instructions i'll post next..."
,efxr,2010-05-01T19:00Z,"So here are the instructions, they're essentially the same as the ones used for CS4, but with updated DNS'es that you need to block.
ONLY ENTER THE SERIAL AFTER YOU'VE BLOCKED THE DNS
Open terminal and type:
sudo /Applications/TextEdit.app/Contents/MacOS/TextEdit /etc/hosts
Hit return and enter your admin password when prompted and again hit return.
Your Hosts file should automatically open in TextEdit.
Add the following to the open Hosts file.
The entries should ideally be made between the existing broadcasthost and ::1localhost entries.
Save the file and quit TextEdit.
In the terminal type:
sudo dscacheutil -flushcache
Activate your product using this serial:

,seqscan,2010-05-01T22:04Z,"@efxr - Thanks for the instructions, but where ever did you get those hosts file entries? Half of them are bullshit (you can't alias TCP/IP ports or URIs, VeriSign CRL servers are actually important, private use ranges, etc.).

I've been using CS4 all this time with only a couple of entries, no trouble so far. I'm not saying the same ones will work, but people wanting to install the latest release should search around a bit for a better guide."

,bradmajorsok,2010-05-02T05:57Z,"Just so everyone knows: The Master Collection trial version that you can download from Adobe's website IS NOT a complete version. Copied from https://www.adobe.com/cfusion/tdrc/index.cfm?product=master_collection:

[...] The trial versions of After Effects CS5, Adobe Premiere Pro CS5, and Soundbooth CS5 [included in the Master Collection trial download] do not include some features that depend on software licensed from parties other than Adobe. For example, some codecs for encoding MPEG formats are available only with the full version of this product.""

It appears that you can only get this additional content when you purchase the software and either opt to receive the boxed media in the mail or as a download files that Adobe provides to you through their online store.
Is this a torrent of the full edition of Master Collection?"
,werring,2010-05-02T08:23Z,"These entries in your /etc/hosts file won't even work
(dont prepend a protocol definition)
127.0.0.1 http://www.wip.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 http://www.wip1.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 http://www.wip2.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 http://www.wip3.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 http://www.wip4.adobe.com
(you can't redirect an IP like this)
(appending a port isn't possible like this)
/etc/hosts file only contains:
| IP | Hostname | Alias* |
*optional"

,kfriede,2010-05-02T08:26Z,"I'm fully with efxr and appreciate what he's done, but am in no way any less appreciative of Stun.  I'm all for downloading from the Adobe site because it's faster and more reliable than a torrent this fresh, but I think we owe it to Stun for having it up here for the rest to download.

As for the trial having less than the ""Full Version"" if you buy the master collection through adobe they have you download the trial and activate that.  It's in no way different than what efxr is suggesting, other than legality.  As for not having the full version, the Adobe download is 5.62GB, while Stun's version here is 5.24 GB.  Doesn't seem like much is missing there to me.  In all likelyhood, Stun's version is probably just the trial anyways.  They're the same."
,kfriede,2010-05-02T08:30Z,"Oh and it looks like Werring got to it before I did, but he's right about the ports.
Plus, unless you're running vectorworks, you probably don't need the three nemetshek domains in there either.  "

,bradmajorsok,2010-05-02T10:04Z,"kfriede: Sorry, but I must disagree. The trial download file (from Adobe's website) isn't exactly the same as what you Adobe provides you when you actually purchase. One proof of this fact is that the trial download doesn't include Adobe Acrobat, which is part of Master Collection; you only receive that when you purchase Master Collection.
From http://www.adobe.com/products/creativesuite/trial/faq/:

A trial version of Acrobat 9 Pro for Mac OS is currently not available. However, the full version of Acrobat 9 Pro for Mac OS is included in the full version of Master Collection available for purchase.""
From that fact alone, it's clear that trial download is not the same as what Adobe provides you when you purchase it."

,FredP,2010-05-04T00:11Z,"BEWARE of AKAMAI

I downloaded the CS5 demo from Adobe using the Akamai downloader (and then installed as per the instructions in this thread).  You should be aware that Akamai installs a program that phones home to a range of sites on a regular basis, and some of the sites seem to be related to activation.  Little Snitch caught it and I blocked outgoing and then deleted the Akamai process that was starting automatically and phoning home.  So far CS5 is functioning fine.  "
,ssiicckk,2010-05-04T00:12Z,"This is what it says on the adobe site:

*Adobe Acrobat® 9 Pro is not available as a trial for Mac OS. Adobe Encore® CS5 software is not available as a trial. Encore CS5 will be installed as part of the trial for Creative Suite 5 Production Premium and Master Collection but will not be available for use until you purchase. The trial versions of Adobe After Effects® CS5, Adobe Premiere® Pro CS5, and Soundbooth® CS5 software do not include some features that depend on software licensed from parties other than Adobe. For example, some codecs for encoding MPEG formats are available only with the full version of these products.
So can someone tell me if Adobe Premiere actually doesn't include those features, or are they just not available in the trial version?"

,efxr,2010-05-07T10:45Z,"Simply using the uninstall feature isn't enough.
Adobe always leaves a shitload of garbage around the place, even if you select 'delete preference' when uninstalling.
Delete the following:
Macintosh HD / Library / Application Support / Adobe
Macintosh HD / Library / Application Support / regid.1986-12.com.adobe
Macintosh HD / Library / Preferences .... delete anything that starts with com.adobe.
Repeat the first and third line in your User library. "

,dljones,2011-07-20T16:53Z,"This did not come as a DMG file (as noted above); rather it downloaded as 59 files (also as noted above). I'm not a Mac person; I did this for my son, who is a Mac user. I have downloaded DMGs for him, so the format of these files (.r(xx) and .rar) leaves me wondering what to do with them. The individual files are 100 MB (mostly), but contain a DMG of >6 GB with RAR packing of different sizes for each file. Your advice would be most appreciated."

,ogge7,2011-09-24T15:23Z,"@dljones and anyone else. The .dmg-file is split up into 57 files due to if a part of the download gets corrupted, they only need to redownload the corrupted RAR and not the whole file.
Simply extract the contents of one of the rar-files to get the dmg. (Rar works like .zip-files)"
